# *1. Create new repository*

Create a new repository on github: click on the + icon in the top right corner and select new repository. Fill in the repository name, description, and choose whether it will be public or private.

# *2. Set up git on your local machine*
```{bash}
git config --global user.name "EoghannWhite"
git config --global user.email "eoghann.white@gmail.com"
```

# *3. Initialize and push your code*

```{bash}
# Navigate to your project directory in the terminal.
cd /Users/eoghannwhite/Documents/IMMUNOCO_Project/GitHubSubmission
# Initialize the git repository.
git init
```

Add code:
```{bash}
# Add all your project to the repository.
git add .
# Commit the files with a message.
git commit -m "Initial commit"
```

Connect to the remote repository:
```{bash}
# Copy the URL of your GitHub repository & and add the remote repository.
git remote add origin https://github.com/EoghannWhite/ImmunocoProject

#### OR IF NEEDED ####

# Change remote URL in github.
git remote set-url origin  https://github.com/EoghannWhite/ImmunocoProject
# Remove remote URL in github.
git remote remove origin
```

Push your code to GitHub:
```{bash}
git config http.postBuffer 524288000
git config --global http.postBuffer 4024288000

git push -u origin main
git branch -m master main
```
